reviewText: This movie is fun to watch and sort of reminiscent to Disney's "Midvale" movies of an earlier time.  The movie is new to me and somewhat different than I might have expected based on the title.  It is a great light-hearted movie to watch.
"The Ghosts of Buxley Hall" is a very funny movie.  Excellent.  The actors that portrayed the ghosts were the right choice.  I shall enjoy watching this movie over & over again.

Buxley Hall is a military academy with few students and even fewer teachers.  In desperate need of cash, they reluctantly, begrudgingly join forces with a girl's school in a similar situation.  Into this muddle of clashing attitudes  arrives a rich boy that everyone assumes is their saving grace, as long as they can keep him happy, keep him at the academy.  Naturally, there are conflicting agendas at work.  The bank wants to foreclose, the boy's penniless aunt wants his money and will gladly get it dead or alive, her rarely seen brother is the boy's legal guardian (for the time being), and lastly the head of the academy (Monte Markham) just wants the boy enrolled because he could lead to an endowment of sorts.  There are three ghosts; two are opposed to females on the premises.  Along the way there's a pillow fight, sexist remarks, mice, an impromptu boxing match, no end of conniving on everyone's part, and the penniless aunt manages to buy the academy with no money, seeking to demolish it with all in attendance.  The humor is broad (from a pie in the face to a b-zillion double-takes).  You can tell it was a made-for-TV movie by the way it's pasted together (lots of abrupt blackouts where the commercials were awkwardly placed).  It's not high art but it has a few fun moments and manages to stay lively thanks in large part to Victor French's performance.
Great Movie From When I Was A Child. Great Service. I Would Certainly Buy From This Seller Again. I'm Happy Disney released ThIs Film Once Again.
It is just as appealing as the first time I saw it some years ago!  It is fun for all ages.

I hadn't seen this Disney film since the 1980s and was glad to re-watch it again on DVD!!! It originally aired in December 1980 during The Wonderful World of Disney. It's a fun movie for the whole family and a nice addition to any Disney DVD collection!!
